verses.verse: The word<WH1697> of Jehovah<WH3068> that came to Jeremiah<WH3414> concerning<WH1697> the drought<WH1226>.
Judah <WH3063> mourneth<WH56>, and the gates<WH8179> thereof languish<WH535>, they sit in black<WH6937> upon the ground<WH776>; and the cry<WH6682> of Jerusalem<WH3389> is gone up<WH5927>.

And their nobles<WH117> send<WH7971> their little ones<WH6810> to the waters<WH4325>: they come<WH935> to the cisterns<WH1356>, and find<WH4672> no water<WH4325>; they return<WH7725> with their vessels<WH3627> empty<WH7387>; they are put to shame<WH3637> and confounded<WH954>, and cover<WH2645> their heads<WH7218>.
Because of the ground<WH127> which is cracked<WH2865>, for that no rain<WH1653> hath been in the land<WH776>, the plowmen<WH406> are put to shame<WH954>, they cover<WH2645> their heads<WH7218>.
Yea <WH365>, the hind also in the field<WH7704> calveth<WH3205>, and forsaketh<WH5800> her young<WH1877>, because there is no grass.
And the wild asses<WH6501> stand<WH5975> on the bare heights<WH8205>, they pant<WH7602> for air<WH7307> like jackals<WH8577>; their eyes<WH5869> fail<WH3615>, because there is no herbage<WH6212>.

Though our iniquities<WH5771> testify<WH6030> against us<WH6213>, work thou for thy name<WH8034>'s sake<WH3068>, O Jehovah; for our backslidings<WH4878> are many<WH7231>; we have sinned against thee<WH2398>.

O thou hope<WH4723> of Israel<WH3478>, the Saviour<WH3467> thereof in the time<WH6256> of trouble<WH6869>, why shouldest thou be as a sojourner<WH1616> in the land<WH776>, and as a wayfaring man<WH732> that turneth aside<WH5186> to tarry for a night<WH3885>?

Why shouldest thou be as a man<WH376> affrighted<WH1724>, as a mighty man<WH1368> that cannot<WH3201> save<WH3467>? yet thou<WH3068>, O Jehovah, art in the midst<WH7130> of us<WH7121>, and we are called by thy name<WH8034>; leave us not<WH3240>.

Thus saith<WH559> Jehovah<WH3068> unto this people<WH5971>, Even so have they loved<WH157> to wander<WH5128>; they have not refrained<WH2820> their feet<WH7272>: therefore Jehovah<WH3068> doth not accept<WH7521> them<WH2142>; now will he remember their iniquity<WH5771>, and visit<WH6485> their sins<WH2403>.
And Jehovah<WH3068> said<WH559> unto me<WH6419>, Pray not for this people<WH5971> for their good<WH2896>.

When they fast<WH6684>, I will not hear<WH8085> their cry<WH7440>; and when they offer<WH5927> burnt-offering<WH5930> and meal-offering<WH5930>, I will not accept<WH7521> them<WH3615>; but I will consume them by the sword<WH2719>, and by the famine<WH7458>, and by the pestilence<WH1698>.

Then said<WH559> I<WH162>, Ah, Lord<WH136> Jehovah<WH3069>! behold<WH5030>, the prophets say<WH559> unto them<WH7200>, Ye shall not see the sword<WH2719>, neither shall ye have famine<WH7458>; but I will give<WH5414> you assured<WH571> peace<WH7965> in this place<WH4725>.

Then Jehovah<WH3068> said<WH559> unto me<WH5030>, The prophets prophesy<WH5012> lies<WH8267> in my name<WH8034>; I sent<WH7971> them not<WH6680>, neither have I commanded them<WH1696>, neither spake I unto them<WH5012>: they prophesy unto you a lying<WH8267> vision<WH2377>, and divination<WH7081>, and a thing of nought<WH457>, and the deceit<WH8649> of their own heart<WH3820>.

Therefore thus saith<WH559> Jehovah<WH3068> concerning the prophets<WH5030> that prophesy<WH5012> in my name<WH8034>, and I sent<WH7971> them not<WH559>, yet they say, Sword<WH2719> and famine<WH7458> shall not be in this land<WH776>: By sword<WH2719> and famine<WH7458> shall those prophets<WH5030> be consumed<WH8552>.

And the people<WH5971> to whom they prophesy<WH5012> shall be cast out<WH7993> in the streets<WH2351> of Jerusalem<WH3389> because<WH6440> of the famine<WH7458> and the sword<WH2719>; and they shall have none to bury<WH6912> them<WH1992>â€”them, their wives<WH802>, nor their sons<WH1121>, nor their daughters<WH1323>: for I will pour<WH8210> their wickedness upon them<WH7451>.

And thou shalt say<WH559> this word<WH1697> unto them<WH5869>, Let mine eyes run down<WH3381> with tears<WH1832> night<WH3915> and day<WH3119>, and let them not cease<WH1820>; for the virgin<WH1330> daughter<WH1323> of my people<WH5971> is broken<WH7665> with a great<WH1419> breach<WH7667>, with a very<WH3966> grievous<WH2470> wound<WH4347>.

If I go forth<WH3318> into the field<WH7704>, then<WH2491>, behold, the slain with the sword<WH2719>! and if I enter<WH935> into the city<WH5892>, then<WH8463>, behold, they that are sick with famine<WH7458>! for both the prophet<WH5030> and the priest<WH3548> go about<WH5503> in the land<WH776>, and have no knowledge<WH3045>.

Hast thou utterly<WH3988> rejected<WH3988> Judah<WH3063>? hath thy soul<WH5315> loathed<WH1602> Zion<WH6726>? why hast thou smitten<WH5221> us<WH4832>, and there is no healing for us<WH6960>? We looked for peace<WH7965>, but no good<WH2896> came<WH6256>; and for a time of healing<WH4832>, and<WH1205>, behold, dismay!
We acknowledge<WH3045>, O Jehovah<WH3068>, our wickedness<WH7562>, and the iniquity<WH5771> of our fathers<WH1>; for we have sinned against thee<WH2398>.
Do not abhor<WH5006> us<WH8034>, for thy name's sake<WH5034>; do not disgrace the throne<WH3678> of thy glory<WH3519>: remember<WH2142>, break<WH6565> not thy covenant with us<WH1285>.

Are there<WH3426> any among the vanities<WH1892> of the nations<WH1471> that can cause rain<WH1652>? or can the heavens<WH8064> give<WH5414> showers<WH7241>? art not thou he<WH3068>, O Jehovah our God<WH430>? therefore we will wait<WH6960> for thee<WH6213>; for thou hast made all these things.
